intro: Aquilaria baillonii, commonly known as the Indian agarwood or fragrant sandalwood, is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic heartwood, which is highly valued in traditional medicine and perfumery. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth margin, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green. Aquilaria baillonii plays an important ecological role in its native habitats and is also threatened by overharvesting.
